thread.title: Heathrow protest: Climate change protesters block tunnel and bring traffic to a standstill | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Heathrow protest: Climate change protesters block tunnel and bring traffic to a standstill | London Evening Standard

author: Hatty Collier
title: Heathrow protest: Climate change protesters block tunnel and bring traffic to a standstill | London Evening Standard
text:
Tuesday 21 February 2017 09:09 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard A protester blocks the road Rising Up 
Traffic was brought to a standstill near Heathrow Airport during the morning rush-hour after activists staged a protest against a third runway. 
Climate change protesters used a vehicle to block the Heathrow Tunnel on the approach to the airport before lying down in the road. 
The blue vehicle was draped with a banner which read "no new runways". 
It is believed the demonstration was being staged by campaign group Rising Up after a video of the protest was streamed live on its Facebook page. 
Photos emerged on social of a gridlocked section of the M4 Spur on the approach to Terminals Two and Three of the airport. @HeathrowAirport @standardnews - so the climate change are at it again pic.twitter.com/tPrfJCGWMC 
Transport for London wrote on Twitter: "The Heathrow Tunnel (into the airport) is currently blocked due to in impromptu demonstration, traffic is slow on M4 Spur." 
Heathrow Airport posted: "Avoid M4 Spur if you can. Heavy traffic around T2/3 due to protest activity." More about:
